Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, probably a kantharos; vertical wall with slightly everted rim; interior glazed black with two pairs of added red bands; exterior: two dilute brown bands below rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of a komos scene to right; head and arm of female figure dancing (added white flesh, red cornea and fillet); naked bearded male figure dancing (beard and red fillet).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.46)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 258, no. 16)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 354, no. B452)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 228, no. 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0737) (Phase 1)
